title: Graph representations of 3D data for machine learning
abstract:
We give an overview of combinatorial methods to represent 3D data, such as
graphs and meshes, from the viewpoint of their amenability to analysis using
machine learning algorithms. We highlight pros and cons of various
representations and we discuss some methods of generating/switching between the
representations. We finally present two concrete applications in life science
and industry. Despite its theoretical nature, our discussion is in general
motivated by, and biased towards real-world challenges.
subjects: Computing Research Repository/Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition
